subject: AI & Agents
title: Anchor Boxes and Feature Pyramids
description: A fast breakdown of Anchor Boxes and Feature Pyramids for builders.

hook.text: How do you detect a tiny bird and a huge truck in the same image?

buildup.text: Anchor boxes are predefined shapes at multiple scales that the detector refines.

discovery.text: Feature pyramids process the image at multiple resolutions, detecting objects at each scale.

twist.text: Anchor-free detectors (like FCOS) skip anchors entirely and predict centers directly.

climax.text: FPN (feature pyramid network) is now standard in most modern detection architectures.

punchline.text: Small and big, all in one forward pass.

quiz.question: What do feature pyramids enable?
options: Detection at multiple scales in one pass
